name: Parser

values.comment: Variant of `<*>` that ignores the result of the parser at the left
values.type: Parser x -> Parser result -> Parser result

values.comment: Variant of `<$>` that ignores the result of the parser
Map a function over the result of the parser
Variant of `<*>` that ignores the result of the parser at the right
values.type: Parser result -> Parser x -> Parser result

values.comment: Sequence two parsers
values.type: Parser (result -> result2) -> Parser result -> Parser result2

values.comment: Choice between two parsers
values.type: Parser result -> Parser result -> Parser result

values.name: and
values.comment:
Sequence two parsers

    type Date = Date Int Int Int
    date = Date `map` year `and` month `and` day
values.type: Parser (result -> result2) -> Parser result -> Parser result2

values.name: andThen
values.comment:
Sequence two parsers, but pass the result of the first parser to the second parser.
    This is useful for creating context sensitive parsers like XML.
values.type: Parser result -> (result -> Parser result2) -> Parser result2

values.name: choice
values.comment: Combine a list of parsers

values.name: empty
values.comment: Parser that always fails

values.name: end
values.comment: Succeeds when input is empty

values.name: many
values.comment: Parses zero or more occurences of a parser

values.name: map
values.comment:
Map a function over the result of the parser
      -- Counts the amount of digits
      count : Parser Int
      count = length `map` many digit

values.name: optional
values.comment: Parses an optional element

values.name: or
values.comment:
Choice between two parsers

      oneOrTwo = symbol '1' `or` symbol '2'
values.type: Parser result -> Parser result -> Parser result

values.name: parse
values.comment: Parse a `String` using a parser, return first result
values.type: Parser result -> String -> Result String result

values.name: parseAll
values.comment: Parse a `String` using a parser, return list of results
values.type: Parser result -> String -> Result String (List result)

values.name: recursively
values.comment:
For realizing otherwise inexpressible recursive grammars. For
example, while

    bbbba = (symbol 'a') `or` (symbol 'b' *> bbbba)

will fail at runtime with a non-termination issue, the replacement

    bbbba = (symbol 'a') `or` (symbol 'b' *> recursively (\() -> bbbba))

is safe.

values.name: satisfy
values.comment: Parser that satisfies a given predicate

values.name: separatedBy
values.comment: Parses a sequence of the first parser, separated by the second parser
values.type: Parser result -> Parser result2 -> Parser (List result)

values.name: some
values.comment: Parses one or more occurences of a parser

values.name: succeed
values.comment: Parser that always succeeds without consuming input

values.name: symbol
values.comment: Parses a symbol

values.name: token
values.comment: Parses a token of symbols

name: Parser.Char
comment:
Parsing characters

@docs upper, lower, between, parenthesized, bracketed, braced

values.name: between
values.comment: Parse a parser between two `Chars`
values.type: Char -> Char -> Parser result -> Parser result

values.name: braced
values.comment: Parses a parser between braces `{` and `}`

values.name: bracketed
values.comment: Parses a parser between brackets `[` and `]`

values.name: lower
values.comment: Parse a lower case character

values.name: parenthesized
values.comment: Parse a parser between parentheses `(` and `)`

values.name: upper
values.comment: Parse a upper case character

name: Parser.Number
comment:
Parsing numbers

@docs digit, natural, integer, float, sign

values.name: digit
values.comment: Parse a digit

values.name: float
values.comment: Parse a float with optional sign

values.name: integer
values.comment: Parse an integer with optional sign

values.name: natural
values.comment: Parse a natural number

values.name: sign
values.comment: Parse a optional sign, succeeds with a -1 if it matches a minus `Char`, otherwise it returns 1
